answer:
If you are now a resident of BC, you can receive publicly funded (free) vaccines that you meet the eligibility criteria for. Read about recommended vaccines for adults here. As you do not yet have MSP coverage, book immunizations at your local health unit. Use the health unit finder. Publicly funded vaccines are also available from some pharmacies and doctors' offices. However, you may be charged a vaccine administration fee in these settings without MSP.
Immunization Nurse
question: Recently moved from UK and no MSP. Can I still receive publicly funded vaccines in BC for free?
